void IrdaTransport::ClearHintBits (  UINT  byte_offset,
UINT8  bit_mask
)  const
 

clear IrDA hint bits

Parameters:
byte_offset Offset of hint byte to modify.
bit_mask Mask of hint bits to clear.

void IrdaTransport::Disable (   ) 
 

Request disabling of the transport (asynchronously).

This method attempts to disable the transport. The result is delivered asynchronously by calling OnAvStateChanged().

void IrdaTransport::Enable (   )  [virtual]
 

Request enabling of the transport (asynchronously).

This method attempts to enable the transport, possibly involving conflict management intervention or MMI activity. Therefore, every implementation is expected to deliver the result asynchronously by calling OnAvStateChanged().

Implements AbstractTransport.

IrdaTransport::AvState IrdaTransport::GetAvState (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the availability state of the transport.

Since state handling can be different for each implementation, this is an abstract method. However, any internal state must be representable by the type AvState

See also:
AvState.

Implements AbstractTransport.

BOOLEAN IrdaTransport::GetConnState (  ConnType  type  )  const
 

Returns the connection state as specified by type.

In case of IrLap returns FALSE if there no connection, any other value indicates an active connection For IrLmp, IrComm and IrObex the TRUE is return if at least one connection of the specified type is open.

IrdaTransport::TransportDisableReason IrdaTransport::GetTransportDisableReason (   )  const
 

Returns the reason why the transport was disabled.

void IrdaTransport::OnAvStateChanged (   ) 
 

Indicates change in the availability state of the transport.

This method must be called by every implementation whenever the availability of the transport is changed. This will generate a TransportNotificationMsg which tells subscribers about the state change.

Reimplemented from AbstractTransport.

UINT8  bit_mask
)  const

byte_offset Offset of hint byte to modify.

void IrdaTransport::SetIrdaHwTimeout (  UINT32  irda_hw_timeout  ) 
 

set IrDA Hardware Timeout

Parameters:
irda_hw_timeout time out in milliseconds.
Use this method to set the IrDA hardware time out to save battery power during idle time. The time out specifies the amount of milliseconds the IrDA hardware remains active after last activity on the interface. The default value is set to 600000 ms = 10 minutes, if Application does not call this function to set a different value. Set to 0 to disable the timer, IrDA hardware will not be switched off in idle state.

void IrdaTransport::SetIsWin98Mode (  BOOLEAN  is_win98_mode  )  [inline]
 

void IrdaTransport::SetNickname (  UINT8  char_set,
const CHAR *  nickname
)  const
 

set IrDA nickname

Parameters:
char_set Character set of nickname.
nickname New nickname (convention: "manufacturor model", e.g. Comneon SuperPhone)
Use this method to set the IrDA nickname as specified in Infrared Data Association Link Management Protocol Version 1.1 chapter 3.4.1.2. Whenever possible use APOXI_IRDA_CHAR_SET_CODE_ASCII as char_set. Note that the actual nickname will be truncated to 20 bytes when 2 hint bits are used.
